areaSection: Campoamor represents one of Orihuela Costa's most exclusive residential zones, renowned for its sophisticated townhouse and villa communities. This southeastern corner of Spain enjoys a Mediterranean climate with 320 days of sunshine annually, offering perfect conditions for year-round outdoor living. The area seamlessly blends contemporary European standards with authentic Spanish coastal character. Orihuela Costa itself comprises five distinct neighborhoods—La Zenia, Cabo Roig, Campoamor, Playa Flamenca, and Villamartín—each offering distinct lifestyle advantages. The region benefits from consistent property value appreciation (+10% year-on-year), established infrastructure, and an international demographic that has shaped sophisticated local amenities. The Costa Blanca's southern coast remains less saturated than northern regions, preserving the exclusive character discerning buyers value.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Campoamor reflects a sophisticated, relaxed Mediterranean rhythm. The neighborhood hosts a strong international community—particularly British, Scandinavian, and Dutch residents—creating a cosmopolitan environment where English is widely spoken. Fine dining establishments line the beachfront, while local tapas bars and international restaurants cater to diverse palates. The weekly mercadillo (market) provides authentic Spanish produce and goods, while La Zenia Boulevard shopping center offers premier retail within 10 minutes. Villamartín Golf Course sits on the doorstep, attracting serious golfers globally. Beach clubs at La Zenia and Campoamor provide sophisticated venues for aperitifs and leisure. Healthcare access is excellent—both Hospital de Torrevieja and Quirónsalud maintain English-speaking medical professionals. The expat-friendly environment means international families find excellent schools, familiar services, and established social networks. This is lifestyle living that balances European sophistication with Mediterranean authenticity.
